fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On page *Project settings->People*, it is expected Jira sorts the available project roles alphabetically to facilitate the searching and selection of them.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On-page *Project settings->People*
 # Add People

h3. Expected Results
 # On the popup window of Adding People, the project roles should be displayed alphabetically.

h3. Actual Results
 # There are no criteria at all, they appeared randomly. Also, an autocomplete field would be better for this purpose.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sort Project Roles Alphabetically

fields.description:
h3.  Summary

When using a JQL that returns more than 1000 issues, attempting to navigate to pages in *List View* until it displays 1001+ (usually page 21 and above) will result in the issue navigator freezing.


h3.  Steps to Reproduce

# Make sure that the JIRA instance has more than 1000 issues.
#  Go to the issue navigator (List View) and run a JQL that returns more than 1000 issues.
#  Navigate the pages until it will display issues 1001-xxxx of xxxx where xxxx is the total number of issues in the # projects. This is usually on page 21 or above by default.

 
h3. Expected Results
 The Issue navigator will return issues 1001 and so on in the page.

h3.  Actual Results

The issue navigator will be stuck loading but nothing will load at all. 
 The rest of the JIRA UI will still be responsive.
fields.summary: When attempting to access more than 1000+ results in List view, the issue navigator will be frozen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Jira users can share filters using the *Share* button regardless of whether or not the filter is private and no users have access to it.

 !_MAKING_PRIVATE__Issue_navigator_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution

If the filter is private, the *Share* button should not be visible as no user would be able to access the filter.
fields.summary: Share filter function should respect filter shares

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is not possible to change the timezone to *(GMT-05:00) Louisville*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Click on your profile icon -> *Settings*;
* Select the timezone *(GMT-05:00) Louisville* in the *Your timezone* field;
* Click on *Save*.

h3. Expected Results

The settings will be saved.

h3. Actual Results

The settings are note saved. There is an error 400 in the browser console.

See the recording:  [^Change timezone.mp4].

h3. Workaround

Select a different close/equivalent timezone.
fields.summary: Cannot set timezone to (GMT-05:00) Louisville

fields.description: Please could users get SVG support for logos in Jira and other similar feature in the Atlassian product set. PNG's loose quality when scaled down.
fields.summary: SVG Support

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Comments edited by another user shows the original users' name in the activity stream

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Service Desk project edit a comment posted by a different user
 # Check the History tab - nothing appears
 # Check Activity Stream - it shows the original user's name as edited

h3. Expected Results
The user who edited the comment should be shown in the Activity Stream

h3. Actual Results
The user who edited the comment should show the user name who edited the comment in the Activity Stream

h3. Workaround
No Workaround
fields.summary: Comments edited by another user shows the original users' name in the activity stream

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Certain users (such as those where they registered with the same email username on the same site more than once) will not be searchable in the `assignee was` clause of jql. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

(This applies to some users only, most users will not have this problem)
 # Assign the impacted user to the issue 
 # Assign a different user to issue
 # Search for the original user E.g. `assignee was some.user`

h3. Expected Results

The issue will be returned
h3. Actual Results

You see the error message `The value 'some.user' does not exist for the field 'assignee'.`
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Some JQL searches using the JQL `assignee was` clause fail to find users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Allow the ability to customize how tables will be displayed in the old issue view. Right now, the table headers break and the information in the column is also affected when other columns have more text.
!Image 2019-10-24 at 5.57.03 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow the ability to customize how tables will be displayed in the old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When transitioning an issue with the validator *Field Assignee should be modified during the transition.* added to the transition, if the assignee is not set in the first attempt and an error happens, the Assignee field displays "No Matches"

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In the workflow, add a validator in any transition using the *Field Assignee should be modified during the transition.* 
# Use this transition and do not update the Assignee field in the first attempt
# An error related to the validator will be displayed.

h3. Expected Results

After the error, you should be able to select the assignee on the user picker field.

h3. Actual Results

When trying to select the assignee a "No Matches" message is displayed. 
The behavior can be [seen in this short video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/RBu0lZvo]

h3. Workaround

Erase the assignee field and use the drop-down to select a new user.
fields.summary: Assignee field showing "No Matches"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you start mentioning users that have the same initials, for example, "Alex" and "Alexander", Jira doesn't focus on any of the options.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start typing the initials of users to mention them
 # Press enter to add the mentioned user

h3. Expected Results
Jira will focus on the first user of the search.

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes, it doesn't focus and pressing enter won't tag any user.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Intermittently Mentioning Users is not Focusing if Typing Fast

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Tickets cannot be found while linking an issue to another. If you have a search (in the issue navigator) done in the past, which doesn’t match with the ticket you are searching while linking an issue to another, you can’t view any issue in the suggestions. But if you have done a “global search” (order by created), you can view all the tickets in the suggestions.

h3. Environment

Issue linking.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Go to the issue navigator (https://instancename.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=) and search for a specific ticket;
# Access a ticket view and try to link another ticket, other than the one you searched before.

h3. Expected results

All tickets should be shown while searching for an issue key.
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-15 at 18.34.18.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result

None issues are found in the search issue field.
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-15 at 18.33.43.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

# Click on the "search for an issue" button and do a new search.
# Go back to the issue navigator (https://instancename.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=) and do a “global search” like order by created.
fields.summary: Tickets cannot be searched while linking an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding a JIRA issue link into a page on Confluence with the new editor experience should link this page into the JIRA ticket, but this is not happening.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy the link of the JIRA ticket;
 # Paste it into a Confluence page (make sure you have the new editor experience);
 # Go to the JIRA ticket.

h3. Expected Results

It shows the Confluence page which you added the JIRA link automatically.
h3. Actual Results

The pages field doesn't come out
h3. Workaround

Click the *Pages* option, on the top of the issue, and then in the drop-list button of the pages option in the JIRA issue and the Confluence page will be listed there. Then, select the page and manually link it.

(!) Please notice (!) 
Linking to a Confluence homepage will fail due to: JRACLOUD-72311
fields.summary: Link a JIRA issue on a Confluence page, with the new editor experience, will not link the Confluence page into the JIRA ticket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user disables the new issue view for Jira Software, the Remaining Estimation field is zeroed, it does not record the value that it has before the migration to the new issue view

h3. Environment
Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Disable the new issue view
# Create an issue and sub-tasks, at the sub-tasks a value for the Original Estimation and Remaining Estimation, it will sum-up the Remianing Estimation to the parent issue
# Enable the new issue view
# At the new issue, on the Parent issue the Remaining Estimation will be 0 and at sub-tasks the Remaining will also be 0.
# Disable the new issue view again.
# The sub-tasks no longer has Remaining Estimations.

h3. Expected Results
The Remaining Estimation should be kept

h3. Actual Results
The Remaining Estimation is 0

h3. Workaround
# Manually add the time estimate to the remaining time
fields.summary: Disabling the new issue view makes the Remaining Estimation be zeroed.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Updating Sub-Tasks' parent through CSV import is causing the Sub-Task list to display duplicated values in the New Issue View.
Also, when including these sub-tasks into a JQL the Bulk Edit feature fails and returns a 500 error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two Story;
# Create a sub-tasks under one of them;
# Create a CSV file with Child Issue, Child Id, Parent ID, Issue Type, Summary;
# Import the CSV file mapping the fields.

h3. Expected Results

The sub-tasks are moved.

h3. Actual Results

The sub-tasks are moved and the values are duplicated in the New Issue View.
The bulk edit feature fails when the Sub-tasks are included in it.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When new users are trying to create a project for the first time in Jira Cloud, the are presenting with a screen as such:

!projectcreate1.png|width=505,height=217!

This "Change template" button could be understood to mean "I want to alter this template" rather than I want to select a different project template.
h3. Suggested Solution

Instead of having the button called "Change template"
 Call it something much more explicit and clear, such as

"Select a different project template"
h3. Why this is important

End users can be easily confused by the text of the button and to leave it as is can mismanage user expectations.
h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Change template button when creating a project is misleading in its intention

The user is not able to share the issue with a group.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue
 # Choose Share
 # Enter the group name

h3. Expected Results

The group name will appear.
h3. Actual Results

The group name does not appear.
h3. Workaround

Create a team with the same name as the group and share it with the team. You may create the team with the following steps:

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Previous State Validator throws Transition Failed Error when the issue is transitioned to the previous status
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a simple workflow (To do, In progress, Done) with All transition enabled
 # Set the Previous State Validator on the To Do status > Publish Workflow
 # Create a new issue > Transition from To Do to In Progress
 # Transition the issue back to To Do

h3. Expected Results
 * The issue is transitioned back to the previous state

h3. Actual Results
 * Throws a validator failed error message:
{code:java}
 An unknown exception occurred executing Validator com.atlassian.jira.workflow.SkippableValidator@2fe8d730It seems that you have tried to perform an illegal workflow operation.
If you think this message is wrong, please contact your Jira administrators. {code}
 !Screenshot from 2019-10-21 12-14-13.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Remove the Workflow Validator
fields.summary: Previous State Validator throws Transition Failed Error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Custom fields type "Text Field (multi-line)" using Wiki Style renderer in old issue view using the monospace type using braces cannot be correctly converted to the new issue view. A text like this breaks:

{{Monospace from the old issue view}} 

h3. Environment

* Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Disable the new issue view
# Create a custom field using the type "Text Field (multi-line)"
# Change the renderer of the field and set it as "Wiki Style Renderer"
# Add the field to a project
# Create an issue and the following value to the custom field created above:
# {{* This is a test (/) OK}}
# Enable the new issue view

h3. Expected Results

The value of the field is displayed 

h3. Actual Results

The field displays the value as "None"

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

- Disable the new issue view to remove the {{ }} characters. To do it, please follow the steps described below:
# Go to Jira home page and click on the avatar at the bottom-left of the screen and then click on *Personal settings*
# Under *Jira labs*, next to *New Jira issue view for software projects*, disable this feature by clicking on the green button (it will become gray and a feedback pop-up will appear)
# Access the affected issue and remove the {{ }} characters.
# Enable the new issue view again, click to edit the affected field to edit
# Select all the text and click on *More formatting(...)* and select *Code*
# Click the save button
fields.summary: Using the monospace text format of the old issue view with asterisks breaks conversion to new issue view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Cloud*. Using *[Jira Server|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-70154]*? See the corresponding suggestion.
{panel}
{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
Hi Everyone, 

We would like to announce the rollout of the Microsoft OAuth for Incoming Emails’ on Jira Software Cloud. The rollout should take a day or two to propagate to all tenants. More details can be found here: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Announcement-Microsoft-Oauth-for-incoming-emails-on-Jira/ba-p/1504721#M3421]

Thank you!

Arjoon Som
 Product Manager, Jira Cloud
{panel}
 
h3. Problem Definition

Office 365 is planning to discontinue support for basic auth on services like POP and IMAP on October 13, 2020. As of today, basic auth (username and password) via IMAP/POP is the only way to make Jira able to use an Office 365 mailbox for receiving email. More details about the upcoming changes to Microsoft's products can be found in [https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/office/blogs/end-of-support-for-basic-authentication-access-to-exchange-online-apis-for-office-365-customers/]
h3. Suggested Solution

Implement some other method of allowing Jira to authenticate to an office 365 mailbox, such as OAuth2.
h3. Why this is important

Without this feature, regular office 365 accounts won't permit applications like Jira to connect to them. It seems that the ProPlus accounts might still permit this after the set date, however it seems clear that improving security is the goal of this forced change, and perhaps it would benefit Jira to follow suit.
h3. Workaround

None currently, if one should become available this will be updated to reflect that state.
fields.summary: Add support for Office 365 Modern Authentication in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Pie chart* gadget will not display results if the filter selected makes reference to another filter in its query (that is, *filter = "filter"*), and that filter being referenced cannot be found in the suggestions when building a JQL query.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a filter called *Incidents*;
* Create multiple filters that contain the word *Incidents* in their names, until the filter called *Incidents* cannot be returned by the search's suggestion when building a JQL query:
 !jql suggestions.png|thumbnail! 
* Build a new filter that will use the previous filter (Incidents) as reference. You can save the query as it is (either with filter = Incidents, or filter = "Incidents"), and the search will work:
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-22 at 11.28.02.png|thumbnail! 
* Create a pie chart, and use the filter you've created on it. Save the preferences.

h3. Expected Results

The gadget will display the results.

h3. Actual Results

No results are displayed.

Instead, an error message with an error 500 is displayed:
{code}
Unfortunately, one or more of your preferences are now unavailable. Please update your preferences, or remove gadget by clicking delete from the title bar above.

filterId should not be null!
500
{code}

h3. Workaround

Instead of using the name of the filter in the query, replace it by its id.

You can get the id of a filter by one of the following ways:
* REST API: https://yourinstance.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/filter/search will return the list of filters, including their ids;
**  *rest/api/3/filter/my* will return the ones you own.
* If you hover over a filter, you will see an URL displaying its id in the end:
 !hover_over.png|thumbnail! 
* Accessing a filter will give you the id in the address bar as well:
 !access.png|thumbnail! 

In my case, the filter query would change from *filter = Incidents* to *filter = 10107*.
fields.summary: Pie Chart will return an error 500 if the filter being used makes reference to another filter that cannot be retrieved by the suggestions when building a JQL query

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
This is an intermittent problem.

The following scenario is not working in the New Jira Issue View:
# A user opens an image from the description or comment section of issue A;
# The user right-clicks the image and clicks "copy", or creates a screen shot of the image which automatically saves the temporary image into the clipboard;
# The user then accesses issue B and try to paste the image into the description or the comment section of that issue by right-clicking the relevant section and clicking "paste".

h3. Expected Results
Jira saves the image as an independent attachment on issue B, and users are able to view and open the image.

h3. Actual Results
After the section is saved (description or comment), the image becomes unavailable and the console throws a *net::ERR_FILE_NOT_FOUND* error. The following video better explains the situation:

 [^JRACLOUD-73238.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Users can first save the attachment into their desktops, then drag and drop the image into the relevant section, as this video better demonstrates:

 [^JRACLOUD-73238-2.mp4]
fields.summary: Using the New View, copying an image from an issue or other source doesn't correctly paste the image on another issue

When an issue comment notification is received on slack, clicking the description in the slack channel opens the comment in the old issue view instead of the new issue view.

Jiracloud

 First a typical Jira Cloud <-> Slack setup:

1. Install Jira Cloud Slack app 
2. Subscribe a Jira Project to a Slack channel: /jira connect
3. Make sure "Comment is created" is enabled.

To reproduce the issue:
1. add a comment to an issue in any subscribed Jira Project.
2. click the issue summary in the 'commented added' message
3. the result is a Jira page with the relevant commented highlighted, but the old page style

Open the comment rendered in the new issue view

h3. Actual Results
The comment is opened rendered in the old issue view.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing your Jira instance, you have the option *Jira settings* in the left sidebar:
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-18 at 11.02.12.png|thumbnail! 

If you click on that option before the whole content of the page has been loaded, it will try to redirect you to a page with the following address: *https://<your instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/GlobalSettings.jspa*, which results in a blank page.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

Replicated in:
* Google Chrome;
* Microsoft Egde (easier to replicate).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Open your Jira instance;
* Click on the *switch to* button (9 dot grid button) -> navigate to a product such as Jira Software;
* Before the whole content of the page has been loaded, click on *Jira settings*.

See the recording:  [^Jira settings navigation problem.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results

The sidebar will load the options that are under *Jira settings*.

h3. Actual Results

Jira tries to load content on the page with the address https://<your instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/GlobalSettings.jspa.

h3. Workaround

If you fall into that problem, navigate to a different section, then try to access Jira settings again.
fields.summary: Quickly navigating to Jira settings will redirect you to an invalid page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the multi-select custom field type does not render on the create issue screen as it render in the new issue view screen.
!create-screen.PNG|thumbnail!  
!Screen Shot 2019-10-18 at 10.18.24.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Suggested Solution

Implement the same render of the new issue view to the create view.

h3. Why this is important

This will give the option to select the option easily. It is extremely difficult for people to create a ticket with a multi-select custom field that has 50+ options since the only way to select multiple options is to hold down the CTRL key.
fields.summary: Change the renderer of the multi-select custom field on the create view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
URL with image syntax (!~~!) tries to convert the link into an image on the new issue view

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue in the new issue view
# paste the following link:
{code:java}
http://www.google.com/(customUrl:!(),endDate:'09-10-2019',isAllSearchEngines:!f,queryType:compare-keywords,resultsPage:'1',resultsPerPage:'200',searchEngineIds:!('112'),work)
{code}


h3. Expected Results
The URL is pasted properly

h3. Actual Results
the URL is broken
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Paste the URL directly into the new issue view or disable the new issue view
fields.summary: URL with image syntax convert the link into an image on the new issue view

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Normally the issue creation pop up screen fields are pre-populated with project details based on the currently selected project in the screen. However the pop up screen for the board page (only this one specific pop up screen)  is not operating by the same logic. It's field values are based on the previously created project.

h3.Steps to Replicate

# Open 2 projects in 2 browser tabs. Project A and Project B. *Ensure that both project are on the board page*.  
!image-2019-10-18-20-05-13-207.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on the '+' sign and create a project on project B.  
!image-2019-10-18-20-06-16-825.png|thumbnail! 
# Proceed with the issue creation page.
# Now attempt the same on the project A tab by clicking the same '+' sign at the side bar.   
!image-2019-10-18-20-47-58-570.png|thumbnail!
# The project will not be project A but project B since it caches the value from project B.

h3. Workaround

No workaround for now. Just have to be careful with the project field value.
fields.summary: JIRA ticket pop up screen caching issue creation details

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 - When you try to use the same high-resolution logo for Space avatar in Confluence and Project avatar in Jira
 - The Avatar in Jira Project is having a low resolution.

h3. Environment
 * Atlassian Cloud for Jira

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a logo with a good resolution.
 # Upload the same under Jira Site=> Project settings => Details => Select image => Upload a new avatar.
 # Same way , go to Confluence site => Space setting => Under overview => Space logo => Edit and upload the same image.
 # Then go to When you use the switch to option in the left panel( NineDot) you can see both space and project details under the recent.

h3. Expected Results
 - Both Confluence and Jira should have the same Resolution.

h3. Actual Results
 - Jira has a Low resolution in Avatar resolutions.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When performing a bulk change to Jira issues, the assignee drop-down field will not be displayed, preventing the user from selecting an assignee.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Issue Navigator, search for some Jira issues.
 # On the top right of the page, click on the ". . ." -> *Bulk change*
 # Select some issues
 # Select *Edit Issues*

h3. Expected Results
The assignee drop-down field should be visible, and the user will be able to search and select a user.
 !Assignee - Expected.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The assignee drop-down field is missing.
 !Assignee missing.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This bug occurs when the user who is performing the bulk operation has different values for "user_name" and "lower_user_name" in the "cwd_user" table. For example:
||id||user_name||lower_user_name||
|10000|John|john|

h3. Workaround
Please contact [Atlassian support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact] to perform a workaround.
fields.summary: When performing a bulk change, the Assignee drop-down field is not being displayed

fields.description:

You should have the option to download the attachment while viewing it.

h3. Actual Results

You do not have the option to download the file, you can only view it.
 
h3. Workaround
No known workaround on the app, to download the attachment you will have to open the Issue through the browser in Jira.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the old view, if you hover over the assignee or reporter, a pop-up of the user will be displayed.

But, if you click on the assignee (or on the reporter), the pop-up will not disappear once you get the cursor out of the user's name. If you scroll down a bit, the pop-up will get hidden behind the left sidebar.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Hover over the assignee or the reporter;
 * Click on the assignee (or reporter).

See the recording: [^User profile pop-up.mp4]
h3. Expected Results

The pop-up will disappear after getting the cursor out of the user's name.
h3. Actual Results

The pop-up will not disappear.
h3. Workaround

Reload the page, that will make the pop-up disappear.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
To change the default email notification send on Jira ([see this doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-cloud-to-send-emails-on-behalf-of-your-domain-900996548.html]) it is needed that the user [verify the domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html#Verifyadomainforyourorganization-VerifyadomainusingDNS] using DNS method and add an *SPF* and *DKIM* records to the DNS table. 

The issue with this current option is that, after the domain is verified on Atlassian, any cloud instance could use that domain to send messages (as long as they use the correct email address).   

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a mechanism to allow users to select the cloud sites that are authorized to use the custom email domain.
fields.summary: Improve the security control for custom email notification sender

 # Go to user management
 # Choose a user and use the "Log in as user" button

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing the issue from Jira, in some case there's a delay in parsing javascript resources from Jira frontend and Cloudfront.
h3. Environment

New and old issue view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to an Issue and load the issue
 # From the har file we could notice some slowness when javascript resources loaded from the frontend and CloudFront.

h3. Expected Results

Navigating to an issue should render quickly by optimizing the javascript resource loaded from the frontend and CloudFront and should be consistent as that page is being cached.
h3. Actual Results

Opening an issue tends to be slow, in some case it might take from *10 seconds* or *> 10 seconds* for a page that already caches from the browser during a hard reload and cacheless reload.
h3. Notes

Due to the slowness in rendering the Javascript resources from frontend/CloudFront, the slowness is actually the same across the issue view (new and old). In most case, here we could see some latency when the browser retrieving the javascript resources particular from the endpoint below:
 * [https://jira-frontend-prod-eu-2.eu-central-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/]
 * [https://cloudfront.net|/]

So in this situation, the On load event can jump to 9.82 seconds to load a page with 21.1MB which is not really optimal in this case since the time to retrieve the javascript prolonged and this caused some latency from the frontend/CloudFront in parsing resources and the time primarily spent in downloading and parsing JS resources.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Slowness in parsing JS resource from Jira frontend and Cloudfront

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
There's is a MacOS based application for Jira Cloud application: https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/mac
This app does not support Jira Server instances

h3. Suggested resolution
Please implement this app to support Jira Server sites, or develop a MacOS based app for Jira Server instances
fields.summary: MacOS Jira app for server users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently in Jira Cloud, users in the site-admin group have automatic default access to all active applications on the site regardless of the [Product Access Settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-product-access-settings-744721629.html].

This is especially troublesome for organisations that have several site-admins but do not necessarily need product access or even use it but will be billed for the license seat.

h3. Proposed solution

Make the site-admin group respect the same logic as other groups so that unless configured so in the *Product access* settings, site-admins don't automatically get product access.
fields.summary: Default product access for site-admin should be like all groups

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Note that, although my steps are for the JSD agent view, the bug applies to the Jira issue view outside of JSD also - it's not JSD specific*

 # Create a new JSD request (any request type).
 # Open the request in the old agent view (with the `?oldIssueView=true` URL param).
 # Add an attachment via the attachments panel. Make note of the attachment you added.
 ** Notice that a comment is added to the request containing the attachment.
 # Remove the attachment via the attachment panel (you can do this in the old agent view by clicking the trash icon or in the new agent view by clicking the 'x').
 ** Notice that the comment now shows an error message like this on the old agent view: 
 *** !old_agent_view_comment_not_found.png|thumbnail! 
 ** Notice that the comment now shows a media loading panel that doesn't load anything: 
 ***  !new_agent_view_comment_not_found.png.png|thumbnail! 
 # Add an attachment via the attachment panel (in the old agent view) _with the same name_ as the attachment you just removed.

h3. Expected Results
The old agent view and the new agent view have consistent behaviour.

h3. Actual Results
The old agent view renders both comments correctly:
 !old_agent_view_comments_no_error.png|thumbnail! 

The new agent view shows an error for the older comment:
 !new_agent_view_comments_with_error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use the old agent view.
fields.summary: An attachment in a comment that has been recreated with the same name renders correctly in the old issue view but shows an error in the new issue view

Disable the new JIRA issue view. You can disable the new issue view using the steps described below:

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When closing a sprint with unfinished issues and moving them to a new sprint, the value of the *Sprint* field is changed to having both the complete sprint and the new sprint that the issue belongs. However, if the issue is moved from one sprint to another before the sprint is completed, only the current sprint will be displayed on the *Sprint* field.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Allow the option to add sprints that aren't yet completed to the *Sprint* field to show up as *Past-sprint*.
fields.summary: Past sprints on issue's sprint field

fields.description:
Currently when you export data, if a story has been part of multiple sprints, the export lists each sprint as an individual field - this makes automated processing of the export file very difficult.

What would be required is to export a single "Latest Sprint" field that contains only the latest sprint for any record, or blank if it has never been allocated to a sprint. 

Additional to that, it would also make sense to make the "Latest Sprint" field available in the issue filter, since multiple past sprints in the same field make it difficult to see what is the current active sprint of the issues.
fields.summary: Export only single Sprint field

fields.description:
At this moment it's not possible to have the same view of the backlog in Jira for Mac as the web browser experience.
It would be useful to have the possibility to align future sprints with the current sprints when analyzing the amount of work left for a release.
fields.summary: Allow the possibility of having the backlog, current and future sprints in the same tab when using Jira for Mac

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Strangely enough, this behaviour is rather odd, which makes the Development panel hidden.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Project
# Go to the *Project Settings > Issue Layout*
# Allow only the "Development" and "Releases Panel" on the "Secondary fields" section.
**  !panel.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an issue e.g. ABC-123, link either *Bitbucket* or Get the *Github* App linked to your Jira Instance.
# Make a commit or create a branch to the issue that you just created.

h3. Expected Results
The commit or branch created should be shown on the issue view for that issue key

h3. Actual Results
The Development panel is hidden from the issue view.

h3. Note
From observation, having only those two fields in the Secondary field section, doesn't render the show more button on the New Issue View, hence the Development Panel is hidden from the issue view. Likewise, I noticed add a System field compatible with the Secondary field will render the "Show more" link, only then will the Development panel be visible. 

h3. Workaround

* Drag both the "Development" and "Releases Panel" from the "Secondary Field" section to the "Primary Field" section for the Development panel to be visible on the issue view.
* Add at least 1 System fields to the "Secondary Fields" section such as e.g. "Sprint", other system fields such as "Priority" won't work as this is still clearly visible in the "Primary field" section.
* Switching to the Old Issue View, you can be able to see the Development Panel
fields.summary: Development Panel becomes Hidden on the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When copying and pasting formatted content from Jira comments to the email body in Gmail from the new issue view in Jira, the body becomes semi-formatted and inconsistent with how the comment is actually seen in Jira. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a comment to a Jira Issue with several formatting (eg. bullet points)
# Copy that comment from the old issue view on Jira and paste it to your email body on Gmail

(jira)
 !_SFF-22__TEST_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

You would expect the comment to be pasted in the same format as Jira as it does on the old issue view.

(old view)
 !Test_old_view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

It pastes the comment while disregarding how the formatting is displayed in Jira

(new view)
 !Test_new_view.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Only tested on Gmail, results may vary with other email clients.

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to copy the comment from the old issue view in Jira and you should get the right format.
fields.summary: Copying formatted comments from new issue view in Jira breaks formatting in Gmail

fields.description:

# /rest/api/3/user?accountId={account.id} also shows the old display name.
# But the display name from https://<instance name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user/search?maxResults=1000&query show us the display name in real-time. 
{quote}
*Note* 

In the Webhooks, we still seeing old display name from the webhook body.

{quote}

The display name shows the changes from id.atlassian.com

h3. Actual Results

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
*Summary*

To satisfy shareholders and to present internal users a manifesto of new features and enhancements that were worked on and completed, I want a switch in the fields section of a card that when I switch it on and the card moves to the Done column on the board, the cards' details will export to a desired destination and with my chosen information of the card so I don't have to manually report of the new feature every time and get lost with all the new additions. I don't want all cards that get moved to Done to be exported, except the cards I choose specifically by a switch within the card. 

 

*Features*
 * Ability to export a card's information automatically to a chosen location
 * The chosen location can be either an excel sheet or a nicely formatted place within Jira that can be privately shared with a link, or other places
 * An on/off switch within the card to decide which get exported
 * Ability to customize which fields get exported
 * Cards will only get exported when moved to the Done column
fields.summary: Switch in Fields to Add Card to External Source

"Site admins – They administer the users and groups for the site’s products. They have access to the site's Administration and access to the products through this group."

As of now we need to manually add the user to the administrator group.
fields.summary: After adding user as site-admin, the user should automatically be added to the administrator group

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Single user picker fields allows you to *Filter Users* using either Roles and/or Groups. If you use Role and Groups in the same filter, and a user meets *two or more* criterias from the filter. The user suggestions will be duplicated for that user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user picker field
# Add the following criterias for filtering (screenshot below)
## Role *A*
## Group *A*
# Add a user to both *A* role and group
# Check the user picker suggestions

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Only 1 entry per user should be shown

h3. Actual Results

Duplicated users are displayed 
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
None, except for avoiding to fall under two criterias of the same user filter only. If you use groups only, even though the user be in 2 or more selected groups, *this won't happen*.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When configuring a mail handler, if a user sets a default reporter, the following message is displayed even though the user is valid and the mail handler works:

{{You haven't provided Default Reporter and Create Users is off. Messages sent by unknown users will be silently ignored.}}

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# From your Jira home page, click *Jira settings > System > Incoming Email*
# Click *Add incoming mail handler*
# Type a name of the mail handler and select the option *Create a new issue from each email message* in the *Handler* field and click *Next*
# Select a valid project and issue type, set a forward email and select a valid user (it can be an administrator user) in the field *Default Reporter*
# Click *Save*

h3. Expected Results

When you select a user, the message {{You haven't provided Default Reporter and Create Users is off. Messages sent by unknown users will be silently ignored.}} is hidden

h3. Actual Results

The message {{You haven't provided Default Reporter and Create Users is off. Messages sent by unknown users will be silently ignored.}} remains visible, being misleading since the mail handler works without problems

 !Screen Shot 2019-10-15 at 2.25.53 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Mail Handlers configuration displays a misleading warning message about the default reporter

fields.description:

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

JIRA pops-up a message saying the filter is saved but when refreshed, filter is not saved.  Query got simplified to {{project = TEST OR project = TST AND issueType = Bug}}.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Saved filter JQL strips redundant parenthesis

fields.description:
h3.  
{panel:title=Aug 15, 2020: New navigation has been rolled out and the old navigation has been removed}
The new navigation has been fully rolled out for all Jira Cloud customers. The old navigation has been permanently replaced and will no longer be available for users to switch back to.

While we feel the changes will be intuitive and easy to pick up, you are welcomed to refer to our official help documentation here: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/new-jira-cloud-navigation-983502691.html]

Thank you to everyone who's shared their feedback and thoughts. Our team has moved on to work on other areas and we are no longer actively monitoring this issue. To provide feedback, please use the Give feedback link in the Help menu.
{panel}
 
h3. What are we doing?

We're in the process of redesigning Jira's navigation (for Jira Software, Jira Service Desk and Jira Core) to help you find and access your work more quickly & efficiently. Here's a sneak peek of what it might look like:

!Next-gen service desk (sneak peek).png|thumbnail!   !Next-gen software (sneak peek).png|thumbnail!
h3. Why are we making this change?

Over the last couple of years, we have heard from numerous customers of their challenges with our current navigation sidebar UI, around navigation, findability, and accessing their work in Jira and Confluence. As a result, our team is now working on an improved navigation UI to better meet the needs of our diverse customer base.
h3. What to expect next?

To keep you as informed as possible, we'll be using this public issue to communicate the progress of our work and also collect missing features in the form of subtasks. As features become available, we'll update the subtasks to let you know what's changed.

If you would like to try an early exploration, you may download & install our [Chrome extension|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/atlassian-navigation-exte/flioipdmdipioibnnoekkadfcoelelil]. Please note that the extension is no longer being actively developed on.
h3. Frequently asked questions
 # *When will my instance receive the new navigation?*
 We will start rolling out the new navigation in the first quarter of 2020. The rollout will take several months and we will send you an email as well as in-app notifications reminding you before your instance is selected for rollout.
 # *I’m an admin of an instance and I will need to communicate this change to my teams. Where can I go to get more information?*
 In addition to the emails we've sent to Jira Cloud admins, we've also published [official documentation here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/new-jira-cloud-navigation-983502691.html].
 # *I’m an admin of an instance and I need more time to communicate this change to my teams. Can I be excluded from the initial rollout?*
 Yes. If you would like to be temporarily exempt from the rollout, please [contact our Support team|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/]. Please note that this exclusion will only be temporary. Once the rollout is completed in early 2020 you will be given notice and prompted to switch over to the new navigation.
 # *How will my users toggle on/off the new navigation?*
 Once we’ve started rolling out the experience, you and your instance’s users will be able to individually toggle on/off the experience by going to the user profile and clicking “_Turn off the new navigation._”  !How to opt out of new nav.png!
 # *I've signed up for the Early Access Program. Will all my users get the new navigation by default?* 
 The new navigation will be OFF by default. Once it is made available for your instance, every individual user will need to opt-in and toggle it on.   !How users can opt-in.jpg|width=382,height=205!  
 # *Where are Boards? Why don't they appear in the top navigation?*
 We don’t plan to add boards to the main navigation bar in Jira Cloud. The main reason for this is to clarify the relationship between projects and boards. We create issues in a project, and boards are one of several ways to _view_ those issues, along with the backlog, queues, and the issue navigator. From this perspective, it makes sense to navigate to a project that shows the various ways you can view and work on issues, including boards. Boards _can_ show issues from multiple projects, but the vast majority show issues from a single project.
 # *How will I get to my Boards if it doesn't appear in the top navigation?*
 The quickest way from anywhere in Jira is by clicking the search field (or pressing / on your keyboard). You’ll see recent boards, projects, and filters in the bottom half of the search panel. We also recommend starring boards so you can quickly find them by going to *Your work* > *Starred*. When you’re in a project, you can also use the board switcher in the sidebar. Click the board name and choose a board or type in its name.
 # *Will the new navigation be available on all Atlassian products?*
 Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud are the only products confirmed to have the new navigation in 2020. There are no commitments at this point for any of our other Cloud products (Bitbucket, Opsgenie, Statuspage, Trello, etc) to be adopting this experience. Server and Datacenter products will remain as-is. 
 # *Will the new (horizontal) navigation completely replace the old (vertical) navigation at some point?*
 Yes, but not straight away. And while we’re in the process of rolling out the new navigation, you’re free to switch back and forth between the two. Once we’ve fully rolled out the new navigation, we’ll begin the process of removing the old navigation, but we’ll let you know before we remove it. We strongly believe our improved navigation will make it easier to use Jira Cloud. The clear labels; quick access to projects, filters, and dashboards; and fewer clicks to move between screens are just a few of the reasons why we think it’ll make navigation easier.

_*Note:* What is and isn't a distinct feature can be tricky to define, especially in something as involved as the navigation. We'll do our best to capture things as accurately and comprehensively as possible._
fields.summary: New Navigation in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
There is some screen where it's tricky to navigate back to the previous screen. Take for example, when I navigate through the workflow schemes, there is no breadcrumb.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While creating a ticket using the plus sign ("+") and changing the issue type of the ticket, the reporter field seems to lose the reference to the correct user, if there is more than one user with the same name. In the backend, the ticket is created with the correct user under the reporter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* 1. Create two users with the same name before the @;
||User Name||Email Address||
|reporteremail|reporteremail@test.com|
|repoteremail|repoteremail@test1.com|
* 2. Hit the plus sign "+" and enter one of the emails in the reporter field.
* 3. Change the issue type and create the ticket.

h3. Expected Results

Jira keeps the reference to the user under the reporter field while hanging between issue types.

h3. Actual Results

Jira seems to lose the reference and when clicking on the reporter field, it shows other users with the same User Name.
See this GIF: https://cl.ly/07ea46cb13d7

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

h3. Notes

Note that, in the backend, Jira *still creates* the ticket under the correct user.
fields.summary: Reporter seems to lose reference when issue type is changed during issue creation

fields.description:
Atlassian update:
Enhancing the page load performance is in our priority list and we are working to at least reach parity with the old issue view and then enhance it further, however, the journey is not easy and we are delivering outcomes iteratively. Please keep an eye on this ticket to learn about our progress and we shall share our shipped improvements as it becomes available 


h3. Issue Summary
It is worth noting that a lot of Performance issues tends to rise in and out of using Jira's Old and New Issue view. All these may be as a result of many of factors, however there's some particular behaviour that occurs sparingly for some users whereby out of a sudden Jira New Issue view tends to become slower compared to the Old Issue view, sometimes it happens in reserve etc.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

(If Applicable view Point)
* Project view
* Issue View
* Board View


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # login to your instance https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net
 # Navigate to a Project
# Try to view an Issue within that Project or from the Board view, given that you have the most basic filter e.g. project = ABC ORDER BY Rank DESC

h3. Expected Results
Navigating to an issue should render quickly in a considerable amount of time e.g. https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-123 within 4-5 seconds and should be consistent as that page is being cached.

h3. Actual Results
Navigating to an issue tends to be slow, in some cases it might be a basic issue and the load time tends to be longer e.g. https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-123 ranging from *10 seconds* or *> 20 seconds* even though the page has been visited all over with CPU thread increasing especially when multiple tabs are concurrently opened.


h3. Notes
Due to this inconsistency, in some cases, the slowness are actually the same across issue view (new and old). First of all when an issue is loaded "the issue title and description are loaded first nearly instantly, but the sections for comments and everything else are loading for a few seconds. And while they are loading CPU usage jumps to 100% and on the Dev console you can notice too many "long running task" being captured with difference ranging from *ms* to *seconds*.

Other examples, lies with the Browser being used - you can notice that in some instances, Chrome tends to consume more CPU thread than Firefox. When loading a simple issue, the CPU thread can spike up really fast especially when multiple tabs are running and the issue that are opened contains an attachment.

Explaining further this factor, out of the many request that are being called when the issue view is loading, they encounter latency, buffering, congestion etc that causes the Javascript resources to pause and block, making it seem like a Javascript issue when in reality it is not, resulting in the pages load taking much longer than usual.

In some situation The TTFB (Time to First Byte) values might be quite low towards a fully loaded page  which might take up to 20 seconds and you might see some Javascript and CSS resources that took 4-5 seconds and they are only 100KB-800KB sizes files.




h3. Workaround

 This behaviour seems to vary
* In some conditions, switching to the *New Issue View* becomes faster to render a page (Probably due to *_SPA_* and *_SSR_* working in pairs)
* In some other conditions, switching to the Old Issue View seems faster to load or have no performance related issues at all.
* Other conditions, would be having a *_Quad Core_* device rather than a *_Dual Core_* device.(based on CPU thread spiking sparingly at various intervals)
* Changing Browsers (From *Chrome* to *Firefox*) might alleviate the situation
fields.summary: Inconsistency in Performance between New and Old Issue View

fields.description:

fields.description:
Dear team, 

When udating the last version of my Add-on (using my "manage Add-on favorite page), I sometimes encountered some issue related to the lastest version of the Add-on. 

Then, I have 2 options : either the impact is low, I wait for bug the correction to be released, either the impact is very important and I have to manually change the "Jar" file and restart Jira. 

By enabling a simple link or button to do so : click on the link,  select the previous version to reinstall, and the Add-on is back to the version with no bug as simple as an update. 

Thank you for considering this suggestion
fields.summary: Add a "downgrade" button or link into the Add-on management page

 !issuelink.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to rename Jira issue link name in Cloud

fields.description:
We need to support IMAP/POP OAuth 2.0 token based auth:

Accordingly to this [post|https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Exchange-Team-Blog/Improving-Security-Together/ba-p/805892] in the Microsoft Tech Community post, Microsoft will stop to support basic authentication for IMAP and POP protocols for Exchange Online by Oct/2020. The only way to authenticate in Exchange Online service for POP/IMAP protocols will be through OAuth 2.0 token based auth.

It may affect our customers that have IMAP/POP Jira Cloud external Mail Handlers configured pointing to this service.

In addition to the Microsoft post we already have another security issue related to that. Both issues may have the same solution. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73004
fields.summary: Support for IMAP/POP OAuth 2.0 token based auth

fields.description:
I recently started to use subtasks for broader projects. I have a couple of designers that only use the "Assigned to me" filter on the Board rather than looking at all issues. 

This has caused some sub-tasks to be forgotten. 

I think it would be helpful if sub-tasks were to show up in the "Assigned to me" filter. They are assigned different issue numbers, anyway.
fields.summary: Have sub-tasks show up when user uses the "Assigned to me" filter

fields.description:
The e-mails informing when a task is moved or commeted are really ugly and kinda useless. There's a lot of information there with no value or simply confusing.

 

My suggestions are:

*Subject is*: [JIRA] TASK NAME

*Subject should be*: Comment in TASK NAME - Jira

 

*Content is*: [link badly formated]

USER updated TASK CODE:
-----------------------------
 Description:

ACTUAL COMMENT

BROKEN IMAGE LINK AND A LOT OF USELESS INFO

/email end

*Content should be*:

USER left a comment in TASK NAME

ACTUAL COMMENT

BUTTON WITH THE TASK LINK

/email end

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating an issue, even though you do not have the *Browse users and groups* global permission, your user will be displayed in the *Reporter* field.

But, currently, if the user does not have that global permission, the user's external id will be displayed instead:
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-11 at 10.46.40.png|thumbnail! 

That seems to occur only in the old view.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Make sure you do not have the *Browse users and groups* global permission;
* Create an issue;
* Check the field *Reporter*;
* When the issue is created, or in other existing issues, click on the field *Reporter*.

See the recording:  [^Reporter field behaviour - old view.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results

Your full name will be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

Your user's external id is displayed instead.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: The field Reporter will display the user's external id if the user does not have browse users and groups global permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Recently accessed project does not show up on the recently viewed project list in Jira mobile
h3. Environment
 * Jira mobile IOS & Andriod

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a project on the website
 # Go to project list on Jira mobile

h3. Expected Results
 * The project is listed in the Recently Viewed project list

h3. Actual Results
 * The project is not added to the list

 
h3. Workaround

Perform an activity on the project (e.g. create a ticket or add a comment), the project would be added to the recently viewed list
fields.summary: projects do not show on the recently view projects in Jira mobile

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Non administrators can share projects and trigger notifications to all users in the site.

e.g.: 
Scenario 1: The notification scheme is set to a project role. A project administrator will have the ability to add a Jira default-access group to the role and so all users will receive notifications.
Scenario 2: User creates a filter subscription an add a Jira default-access group. The users might receive notifications every 15minutes.


h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to keep some groups hidden from non administrators.
fields.summary: Ability to hide groups from non administrators users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? See the [corresponding bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-70091].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

In Brazil, we won't have daylight saving in 2019 and it may impact our products.

On October 20, our timezone in Brazil would change to GMT -2, but in 2019 it won't happen, so the timezone in Jira and Confluence may change and affect Due Dates, SLAs, Team calendar among other things.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Any field tied to a timezone change will be affected.
 It may also affect SLA for Service Desk issues.
h3. Expected Results

On October 20, it should keep GMT -3 for Sao Paulo's timezone.
h3. Actual Results

It will show the wrong information because the timezone will be GMT -2.
h3. Workaround

Change the timezone manually to GMT -3 using another country's timezone, like Recife or Argentina (Buenos Aires).
fields.summary: Brazil's daylight saving
